title: Preset
description: Associates an icon, form fields, and other UI with a set of OSM tags

name.description: The English name for the feature. A preset can reference the label of another by using that preset's identifier contained in brackets (e.g. {preset}), in which case also the preset's aliases and terms will also be referenced from that preset.

geometry.description: Valid geometry types for the feature, in order of preference

tags.description: Tags that must be present for the preset to match

addTags.description: Tags that are added when changing to the preset (default is the same value as 'tags')

removeTags.description: Tags that are removed when changing to another preset (default is the same value as 'addTags' which in turn defaults to 'tags')

fields.description: Default form fields that are displayed for the preset. A preset can reference the fields of another by using that preset's identifier contained in brackets, like {preset}.

moreFields.description: Additional form fields that can be attached with the 'Add field' dropdown. A preset can reference the "moreFields" of another by using that preset's identifier contained in brackets, like {preset}.

icon.description: Name of preset icon which represents this preset

imageURL.description: The URL of a remote image that is more specific than 'icon'

terms.description: English search terms or related keywords

searchable.description: Whether or not the preset will be suggested via search

matchScore.description: The quality score this preset will receive when being compared with other matches (higher is better)

reference.description: Taginfo documentation parameters (to be used when a preset manages multiple tags)

value.description: For documentation of a tag (key and value)

replacement.description: The ID of a preset that is preferable to this one

locationSet.description: An object specifying the IDs of regions where this preset is or isn't valid. See: https://github.com/ideditor/location-conflation

relationCrossReference.description: A preset can reference the relation schema from another preset

optionalTags.description: Only useful for specifying placeholders which are referenced in members.*.matchTags

roles.description: Map of roles to their label in the default language. An empty string is allowed as key.

geometry.description: If not specified, any geometry is allowed

matchTags.description: `*` can be used as a tag value. If multiple array items are specified, only 1 needs to match.

min.description: If unspecified, there is no minimum

max.description: If unspecified, there is no maximum
